Articles.Content: Is there any consensus on which is the best Tech tree for heavily modded games?

> 
> Is there any consensus on which is the best Tech tree for heavily modded games?

Nope, no consenus. There are a lot of different tech trees providing a variety of progression experiences.

Though at the moment, only very few have been updated to the radically changed (disimproved) KSP 1.0.x techtree definition.

For modded games I m only aware of the [**CTT**](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/100385) and the [**SETI-CTT**](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/106130) (which is an addon to the former, starting with probes and other changes) being available for 1.0.x.

There's no one "best" tree, it's what fits your playstyle best. Most tech trees support mods reasonably well, but the [Community Tech Tree](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/100385) is designed specifically to provide a tech tree for modders to place parts in, rather than just rearranging stock parts. It's based on the stock tech tree and has a ton of mod support.

If you would rather not start with manned pods, [SETI](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/106130-0-90-SETI-BalanceMod-Scope-Economy-Tech-Integration-v0-7-6-Feb-13?highlight=seti) provides an extension to the CTT that reworks a few nodes and moves a bunch of parts around to better fit starting with probes. Since it's based on the CTT, it still has excellent mod support. Disclaimer: If you didn't notice from my signature, I very much like SETI. It's my personal favorite.

A few others as well (copied from the SETI page, I haven't tried these personally):

[Mod-Oriented Tech Tree](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/90938) - 2 versions available, one for a manned start and one for an unmanned start

[KSAEA](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/94271) - Kerbal Space and Atmospheric Exploration Agency Tech Tree and Game Rebalance

[Adios Tech Tree](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/108785) - Star shaped, category based tech tree, manned and unmanned start available

[Road to Kosmos](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/109672) - Tech progress based on historical space programs

Anyways, hope that helps you find a tech tree that fits how you want to play the game.

Edit:

Ninja'd by the author of SETI himself...
